entry.title: FSLabs Launches New Website with Further A321ceo Details Included
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS20. Flight Sim Labs recently launched their new website design, featuring a landing page for their upcoming A321ceo for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and a selection of screenshots, details, pricing information, and more. The company rose to fame in 2016 after releasing the first high-fidelity Airbus A320 add-on. This add-on allowed Microsoft Flight Simulator X and Prepar3d users to experience the day-to-day operation of one of the most popular airliners, one that had not yet been developed to such standards (which quickly changed within five years). Described as âthe most advanced Airbus A321ceo simulation for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020â, FSLabsâ upcoming bird is said to bring a combination of cutting-edge technology with unrivaled attention to detail, featuring immersive cabin operations, custom MEL (minimum equipment list) systems, next-generation visuals, enhanced systems, dynamic effects, realistic operational hazards, and real-world navigation obstacles such as GPS jamming, based on real-world data.Â The add-on will retail for $69.99 and feature two engine options (CFM56 and IAE V2500), wingtip fences and/or sharklets, totaling up to four variants included in the package. They have also announced the development of an A321neo next, which is still being worked on but is said to âfollow shortly behindâ the release of the current engine option variant. Owners of the ceo between its release and the Neoâs release will be eligible for a discount. Refer to their website for further information on the upcoming product(s). Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â

entry.title: Taimodels Releases Beijing Daxing International Airport for MSFS 20/24
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Taimodels has recently launched its rendition of Beijing Daxing International Airport (ZBAD) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024. This airport, which serves the capital of China alongside Beijing Capital International Airport, opened just five years ago. It accommodates nearly 40 million passengers each year. After years of proposals, the construction of the new airport was officially approved in 2014. Following five years of construction, the airport opened its doors on September 25, 2019, with its first commercial flight occurring the next day. The airport serves as a hub for six airlines: Air China, Beijing Capital Airlines, China Eastern Airlines, China Southern Airlines, China United Airlines, and XiamenAir. Additionally, it is a focus city for Hebei Airlines. However, the airport is not limited to these carriers; it accommodates numerous airlines from around the globe, offering flights to various destinations, including Hong Kong, Amsterdam, Doha, and many more. The newly released version of Beijing Daxing International Airport includes realistic terminals, airport buildings, PBR ground markings, realistic lighting, custom jetways, and other features. The scenery requires 4.54 GB of storage space and is available on SimMarket for about $23.44. â For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned on Threshold!

entry.title: Fly2High Releases Jackson-Medgar Wiley Evers International Airport for X-Plane 11 & 12
entry.summary: Sim: X-Plane. Fly2High recently released their rendition of Jackson-Medgar Wiley Evers International Airport (KJAN) for X-Plane 11 and 12. The airport serves the Jackson metropolitan area and has a yearly average of 1 million passengers. The airport opened in 1963, replacing Hawkins Field, Jacksonâs former main airport since 1928. Construction took around three years and cost 6 million USD (equivalent to 56,000,000 USD in 2023).Â Itâs named after Medgar Evers (since 2005), a Mississippi Field Secretary for the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People (NAACP), who was assassinated in June 1963.Â Â Â The airport is served by American Eagle (Charlotte, Dallas-Fort Worth, Washington-National), Delta Air Lines (Atlanta), Southwest Airlines (Atlanta, Baltimore, Houston-Hobby, Orlando), and United Express (Houston-Intercontinental). In addition to passenger flights, the airport handles cargo shipments, with UPS flying to Louisville. The scenery features an accurate rendition of the airport, with hand-placed night lighting, 3D vegetation, weather effects (X-Plane 12 only), high-quality PBR texturing, custom terminal interior, and more. Itâs available on X-Plane.Orgâs Store for $17.99, requiring at least 1.6 GB of free hard disk space to install. Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â

entry.title: Microsoft Launches New MSFS 2024 Update
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Microsoft recently issued a new update to their newly released Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024, bringing a series of stability, performance fixes, and minor SDK tweaks. Update 1.1.10.0 â the second update since release so far â fixes a crash when navigating fast between the challenges, mitigates an issue with adjusting Tobii Eye Tracker settings in the menu, and addresses various crashes that were reported by the users. Furthermore, the update fixes the floating jetway issue that has plagued the simulator since its release. It also corrects the unloading and reloading of WASM gauges upon restarting a flight. â The complete changelog for the update follows below: Stability & Performance â General Bug Fixes â SDK JS API â Aircraft â Aircraft tech â Model behavior â Flow/Progression â MyLibrary â The update is available right now on Steam and Microsoft Store.Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â

entry.title: iniBuilds Releases Brisbane Airport for MSFS 2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. iniBuilds has recently released their rendition of Brisbane Airport (YBBN) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024. Brisbane Airport is the largest airport in Australia by land area and the third busiest in passenger traffic, with a yearly average of 23.2 million passengers. The airportâs construction started in 1980. Built by Leighton Contractors, it cost 400 million dollars and opened eight years later. It initially had a domestic terminal and two runways. Nearly a decade later, in September 1995, the international terminal was inaugurated, bringing in further passenger traffic. In 2007, the government approved the construction of a new parallel runway, which was expected to take eight years to build on swamp land 2 kilometers west of the terminal area. The unexpectedly long construction time was due to the settling period of the 13,000,000 cubic meters of sand gathered from Moreton Bay to cover the swamp. Work was completed in 2020, costing $1 billion and taking precisely eight years from start to finish. Itâs a hub for Qantas and Virgin Australia. Air Canada, Air Niugini, Alliance Airlines, American Airlines, Batik Air Malaysia, Cathay Pacific, China Airlines, China Eastern Airlines, China Southern Airlines, Delta Air Lines, Emirates, EVA Air, Fiji Airways, FlyPelican, Jetstar, Korean Air, Link Airways, National Jet Express, Nauru Airlines, Philippine Airlines, Qantas, QantasLink, Qatar Airways, Singapore Airlines, Skytrans Airlines, Solomon Airlines, United Airlines, VietJet Air, and Virgin Australia also serve it. The scenery features an accurate rendition of the airport, with hand-made ground textures, true-to-life landside recreation, custom dynamic lighting, highly detailed models of all airport buildings, and an up-to-date layout.Â Itâs available on the iniBuilds Store for roughly $22.72, requiring at least 8.32 GB of free hard disk space to install. Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â

entry.title: Fenix Simulations Updates A320 Lineup for MSFS 20/24
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Fenix Simulations has recently issued another update â the third in the span of a few weeks â to their A320 lineup (A319/A320/A321) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024, adding Quality of Life improvements and warranting further stability on both platforms. Update 2.3.0.541, very much like the previous update, primarily focuses on improving the stability and usability of the add-on in both platforms, addressing issues that would lead to CTDs, improving the robustness of displays, fixing pause at the top of descent, further improving the loading and unloading of the product in MSFS 2024, and wholly mitigating a clickspot issue in the EFB, also a 2024-only issue. The complete changelog follows below: Avionics and Systems EFB Their product lineup is available on their website for roughly $114 (at the time of writing). Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â

entry.title: Flysimware Releases Learjet 35A Cargo Expansion
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS20. Flysimware has released an expansion pack for their Learjet 35A for MSFS. The expansion pack contains three versions of Learjet 35A Cargo - LJ35A equipped with GNS530, GTN750 and GTN750Xi (the latter two require PMS50 GTN750 and GTN750Xi respectively). Based on one of the most popular business jets - the Learjet 35A, the cargo version is capable of carrying up to 900kg, and with the power from two TFE731-2-2B of payload to distances up to 3000km (~1620nmi). The cargo version features a modelled cargo hold, 4K PBR textures and 8 liveries. The expansion pack is available for purchase at Flysimwareâs store for $14.99.Â For more information about the product, check out the Flysimware Discord. â

entry.title: Leonardo Announces Upcoming Maddog X Compatibility for MSFS 2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Leonardo recently shared information on their forum regarding compatibility with Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 for their Maddog X. The team noted the learning curve presented by the new simulator but emphasized their commitment to addressing the various issues it has introduced. The team has announced that the Maddog X will soon be available for MSFS 2024 as a native upgrade. This upgrade will be free for customers who own the aircraft for MSFS 2020. Additionally, the team is working on an optional expansion to further enhance the add-on, ensuring it meets what they refer to as âFS2020 standardsâ in terms of modelling, texturing, and sound. There is currently no ETA for this expansion. We will keep you updated as soon as the Maddog X is available for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024. For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned on Threshold!

entry.title: PMDG Releases Boeing 777F for MSFS 2020
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS20. PMDG recently released their long-awaited Boeing 777F for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020. This is one of the worldâs most popular cargo haulers still in production, famous for its fuel efficiency and range. Developed by Boeing to meet the ever-growing demand for highly efficient air cargo transport, it has been hugely successful since its introduction in 2009. Ever since, it has been carrying massive payloads across the globe for many different operators.Â Powered by two GE90-110B1 engines, which generate enough thrust to lift over 100,000 kilograms of cargo within 550 cubic meters, easily carrying oversized â and heavy â cargo to virtually any destination with a long enough runway. The add-on features an advanced simulation of all avionics and system management operations of the 777 flight deck, an accurately simulated display drawing process, a full electronic checklist, the PMDG Universal Flight Tablet, a full simulation of the 777âs autoflight director and autopilot systems, and more. The complete feature list follows below: â PMDG 777F features Avionics & Flight Deck: Air Conditioning System: Auto-flight System: Brakes and Tires: Cargo Main Deck: Datalink (Currently limited to Hopie Network for ATC services, but more coming!): Doors: Electrical System: Engines: Failures: Flight Controls and Flight Surfaces: Fly By Wire System: Fuel System: Ground Service Vehicles: Hydraulic System: Landing Gear: Lighting Systems: Navigation Data: Physics-based Flexing: Pneumatic System: Simulator Features: As mentioned in their last development update, the 777F is not yet compatible with Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 due to issues with the new SDK. The airplane is available at PMDG.com for $54.99. Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â

entry.title: Just Flight Updates RJ Professional Bringing MSFS 2024 Compatibility
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Just Flight has updated its RJ Professional add-on to version 1.2. The most notable change is the added compatibility with Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024. Additionally, the aircraft has undergone various fixes and improvements. The new update includes several fixes and improvements. The EFB has received various updates, and the previous issue with the GSX fuel truck not disconnecting after refueling has also been resolved. Additionally, several manuals have been updated. The changelog for the update is provided below: â v1.2 (0.1.2) â - Added MSFS 2024 compatibility - Fixed GSX fuel truck not disconnecting after refuelling complete - Fixed overlapping text on EFB Aircraft > Configuration menu - Fixed cabin GND PWR AVAIL light logic â Now remains illuminated whenever external power is available - Added âfade inâ / âfade outâ effects to exterior lighting to simulated incandescent bulbs - Fixed unable to change speeds flipchart after toggle EFB option on/off - Improved EFB page transition between WASM and JS/HTML pages - Improved navigation light electrical source â One Nav light on each wing tip is powered by ESS DC, the other by the Ground Service Bus. - Updated RJ Professional Operations manual - Updated RJ Professional EFB manual - Updated GNLU-910A FMS Operations manual The updated RJ Professional is now available for both Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024. The aircraft can be purchased directly from Just Flight for $69.99. For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned on Threshold!

entry.title: FSA Announces FSExpo 2025 Registration Opening December 14
entry.summary: Sim: OTHER. The Flight Simulation Association (FSA) announced in a recent press release that registration for FlightSimExpo 2025 will open on December 14th. Starting next Saturday at 12 PM Eastern Time, you can sign up for the upcoming FlightSimExpo, which will be held in Providence, Rhode Island. For non-members, access from Friday to Sunday is priced at $80. For FSA First Officers, the cost is $72. If you are an FSA Captain, you will pay $64. However, if you are among the first 250 FSA Captains to register, your price will be just $50.Â â All pricing options include access to seminars and exhibit halls from Friday to Sunday. Participants will also receive access to post-event seminar recordings, a welcome drink during Fridayâs reception, and coffee and tea provided on Saturday and Sunday mornings.Â â If you are unable to attend FlightSimExpo in person, you can register for live and recorded seminar access for $15. FSA Captains can access this content for free. If you or your team would like to sponsor, exhibit, or speak at the Expo, FlightSimExpo invites developers to register using the following link. Regarding travel and accommodation, discounted rates are currently available. According to co-founder Evan Reiter, one-third of the available rooms have already been booked. The discounted hotel rates represent some of the lowest group rates for a 4-star hotel in downtown Providence during a summer event. You can find more details about accommodation and travel at the following link. FlightSimExpo 2025 will be held in Providence from June 27 to June 29. Registration will open next week on December 14, so set your alarms if you plan to attend next year's FlightSimExpo. â For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned on Threshold!

entry.title: FlightSimLabs Releases Airbus A321ceo for MSFS 2020
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS20. FlightSimLabs has just launched its highly anticipated version of the Airbus A321ceo for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020. This rendition of the longest variant in the Airbus A320ceo family is now available to take to the virtual skies. The Airbus A321ceo is a twin-engine, single-aisle commercial aircraft that had its first flight in 1993. Since then, a total of 1,784 A321ceos have been built and delivered. This model can be equipped with either CFM or IAE engines and can feature sharklets or wingtip fences. The A321ceo is the predecessor to the newer A321neo, with the primary difference being the new engine option in the neo version. The A321ceo is operated by airlines around the world, including American Airlines, Turkish Airlines, and Lufthansa. FlightSimLabâs rendition of the Airbus A321ceo includes a wide range of features. It offers options for both CFM and IAE engines, as well as variants with wingtip fences and sharklets. The aircraft model is highly detailed, showcasing realistic weather and environmental effects. Additional features include dynamic failures, aircraft aging, an electronic flight bag (EFB), GSX integration, and much more, all contributing to a highly realistic simulation of the aircraft and its systems. The newly released Airbus A321ceo is now available for purchase directly from FlightSimLabs for $69.95. â For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned on Threshold!

entry.title: iniBuilds Updates A300-600R for MSFS 2024 Compatibility
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. iniBuilds has recently issued an update to their A300-600R product line, making it compatible with Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024, albeit in a Beta state with a few caveats. Version 1.1.3 introduces compatibility with the newly released flight simulator, but there are some known issues to be aware of for the time being: terrain display problems, loss of overhead Korry switch and ambient packs/bleed sounds when switching views, random TCAS RA errors from the plane itself and networking issues. Initially released a year ago for MSFS 2020, the add-on features a detailed custom flight management system with SIDs, STARs, an SEC flight plan, custom VNAV and LNAV, an IDC radio with CPDLC and ACARS, custom systems, two engine options (PW and GE), a realistic RNAV, custom maintenance functions, and more. Itâs available on the iniBuilds Store for roughly $44.59, requiring at least 8.81 GB of free hard disk space to install. Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â

entry.title: Microsoft Releases New MSFS 2024 Update
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Microsoft recently issued a new update (1.2.7.0) to its newly released Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024. This update allows users to enable/disable MSFS 2020âs (Marketplace) individually ported content, provides additional stability and performance fixes, and more. Update 1.2.7.0 is the most significant so far, addressing a few items that were previously requested by the community, such as the option to individually enable or disable ported marketplace content from Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020, and bringing a considerable list of fixes, warranting further stability and better performance. The complete changelog (for stability and bug fixes) follows below: â Stability & Performance â General Bug Fixes â Please refer to the official release notes for the full spectrum on a per-aircraft basis. â The update is available right now on all supported platforms. Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â

entry.title: MK Studios Release Zurich for MSFS
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. MK Studios has released its latest scenery for MSFS20 and 24. The team has headed to Zurich, Switzerland's largest city, offering many custom features and high-quality models. Zurich acts as the main gateway into Switzerland having served 28.9 million passengers in 2023. It is also the main base for the flag carrier airline: Swiss. Allowing for routes across Europe and further. The team have made sure to allow for compatibility with both sims allowing users from FS20 & 24 to utilise it. The scenery is filled with high-quality textures on the building's exteriors, interiors and groundwork. All working together to give an accurate depiction of the airport. This is paired with custom objects to match real life, increasing realism. Concourse A,B and E feature a modelled interior, this is a growing feature we are seeing in sceneries that adds a level of depth to the terminal buildings when parked at the gates.Â Below is the full feature list: MK Studios Zurich is priced atÂ Â£15.11excl.VAT and can be purchased from the Contrail Shop.Â Make sure to stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news and join the community through our Discord.

entry.title: Headwind Simulations Updates Airbus A339X and SU95X for MSFS 2020
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS20. Headwind Simulations has recently released updates for its A339X and SU95X projects for MSFS. The new update integrates SayIntentions.AI ACARS and CPDLC into both aircraft. SayIntentions.AI is an AI ATC (Air Traffic Control) plugin designed for various flight simulators. It provides features such as ATC, copilots, cabin crew, and more, all powered by artificial intelligence. A key component of the ATC functionality in SayIntentions.AI includes ACARS (Aircraft Communications Addressing and Reporting System) and CPDLC (Controller-Pilot Data Link Communications). These systems facilitate communication between the ground and the aircraft, allowing for interactions between air traffic controllers and pilots. â With the recent integration of ACARS and CPDLC from SayIntentions.AI into Headwind Simulationâs aircraft, users can now access these features. Please note that a Premium Membership is required to utilise this feature. The latest updates for the A339X and the SU95X are now accessible via the Headwind Simulations installer. Since the update is part of the pre-release channels, be sure to select this option for the most recent update. For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned on Threshold!
